description: Basic concepts: pressure, density, velocity, forces. The standard atmosphere. Introduction to low speed aerodynamics. Airfoils, wings, and other aerodynamic shapes. Aircraft performance. Aircraft stability and control. Aircraft propulsion.
name: INTRO TO FLIGHT

values.comments:
This course covers the basic concepts of pressure, density, velocity, forces and
provides an introduction to low speed aerodynamics including airfoils, wings, and other
aerodynamic shapes. Aircraft performance, aircraft stability and control, and aircraft
propulsion were also covered.
This course was an informative introduction class to aeronautical engineering. A
student stated that they “got a lot out of the course” There were complaints about the
textbook, which was “seemingly filled with ‘historical’ information, [but] rather dry with
technical details [of theories]”.
Professor Kothmann is highly praised as a teacher who wants his students to
succeed. Kothmann is also respected for his experience as an engineer in the aviation
industry, covering “many ideas and topics pertaining to flight while not getting too
detailed or complicated to understand.” Students highly appreciated his accessibility, his
willingness to help students understanding the material, and his prompt replies to emails.
This class is meant for and highly recommended for sophomores in the
mechanical engineering department. However, non-majors could keep up, but
knowledge of Math 240 is highly recommended. A student said, “I expected a course
that provided an introduction to broad topics in mechanical engineering within the
context of flight, and that's exactly what I got.”
